alert.note: Alert for Robertson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 6:45PM CDT until July 26 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Robertson. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to stationary thunderstorms between Springfield and Cross Plains. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Cross Plains and Orlinda. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
